newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Former South Australian minister cleared by police.
newsitem.headline: Former South Australian minister cleared by police.

text.p: Former South Australian finance minister Dale Baker had been cleared of criminal wrong-doing over alleged impropriety in a land deal, the State's Attorney General Trevor Griffin said on Friday.

But Baker now faced a government inquiry into allegations that he had a conflict of interest in relation to the deal and conducted private business while on a ministerial visit to Hong Kong, Griffin said in a statement.

Baker, a former Liberal Opposition leader, stood down from the ministry in February following allegations he was involved in a private bid to buy land in the south east of the State in which his department was also interested.

Griffin said he had been advised by the Director of Public Prosecution, Paul Rofe QC, following an inquiry by the anti-corruption branch of the State police, that in his view there was no evidence of criminal behaviour on Baker's part.
The conflict of interest inquiry, to be conducted by Tim Anderson QC, was expected to be completed in a month, he said.
